waves.rationale: US-001 creates src/routes/+error.svelte (new error boundary component). US-003 modifies WelcomeScreen.svelte (existing welcome component). These are completely different files with no overlap. US-001 is a root-level route error handler, US-003 is a chat welcome screen component. Safe to parallelize.

US-002 modifies chat.svelte.ts (adds timeout logic and error handling). US-004 also modifies chat.svelte.ts (adds toast notifications to store operations). Both stories explicitly touch the same store file. Additionally, US-002 mentions error toast behavior and US-004 wires toast notifications, creating logical coupling. Must serialize to avoid merge conflicts and ensure toast integration works correctly with timeout error handling.

risks: US-002 and US-004 both modify chat.svelte.ts - serialized to prevent conflicts
US-004 touches multiple store files (spaces.svelte.ts, areas.svelte.ts, chat.svelte.ts) - if future stories touch these stores, careful sequencing required
Toast notification wiring in US-004 may need adjustment after US-002's error handling is implemented
